docs.abstract: Medical researchers probe beneficial effects of nicotine that were first noted in cigarette smokers, including properties that might be useful in treating Parkinson's and Alzheimer's diseases; research has risen with recent development of nicotine in nontobacco forms and with better understanding of how the chemical works in the body, particularly in the brain; smokers have been found to have half the risk of developing Parkinson's disease as those who have never smoked, and nicotine appears to interfere with the formation of beta amyloid plaque deposits in Alzheimer's patients; drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: IN work that sounds a little like scientific blasphemy, medical researchers have begun paying increasing attention to some beneficial effects of nicotine that were first noticed in cigarette smokers. After years of quiet discussion among scientists, hints that cigarettes can protect against some diseases or improve the outcome of others have led to growing interest in finding out why. This has focused attention on nicotine, tobacco's most active ingredient, as a potential treatment for several major health problems, including Parkinson's and Alzheimer's diseases.

docs.abstract: Molly O'Neill article on having her Manhattan loft analyzed by several practitioners of feng shui, the Chinese and Tibetan art of placing objects to enhance harmony and good luck, which more and more Americans are applying to their real estate and decorating decisions; says American facination with feng shui may suggest certain things about society, like a need for order or spiritual fulfillment; says its fast growth brings with it a danger of charlatanism; photos (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: THE litter box could have ruined me. Four of the world's leading feng shui practitioners were huddled over my cats' privy, their luo pans quivering with alarm. They stared at their trusty compasses in disbelief: the box was placed precisely on the point of ''fortunate blessing'' in the southeast corner of my Manhattan loft. It was inviting financial, emotional and professional disaster.
